Title:
Two new Neofomitella species (Polyporaceae, Basidiomycota)
based on morphological and molecular evidence
Keywords:
Multi-locus analysis, phylogeny, Polyporaceae, taxonomy,
wood-rotting fungi
Abstract:
Two Neofomitella species, sp1 and sp2 are described as new
based on morphological and molecular characters. Sp1 is characterized by
round to angular pores (56 per mm), weakly dextrinoid skeletal and
binding hyphae and big basidiospores (5.57.5 × 1.82.2 μm). Neofomitella
sp2 is characterized by white pore surface when fresh, dextrinoid
skeletal and binding hyphae, orange red context near pileal surface when
fresh. Phylogenetic analysis inferred from the internal transcribed
spacer (ITS), the large subunit nuclear ribosomal RNA gene (nLSU), the
small subunit nuclear ribosomal RNA gene (nSSU), the small subunit
mitochondrial rRNA gene (mtSSU), the translation elongation factor 1-α
gene (EF1-α), the largest subunit of RNA polymerase II (RPB1) and the
second largest subunit of RNA polymerase II (RPB2), confirmed affinity
with the Neofomitella species. An identification key to Neofomitella is
provided.
